intro: Pentaclethra eetveldeana, commonly known as the Eetvelde's pentaclethra, is a flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of Central and South America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces pods that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind or animals. It plays an important role in its ecosystem by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
